Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model

External_Reference.reference_text: Delva, M., K. Schwingenschuh, M.B. Niedner, K.I. Gringauz, W. Riedler, C.T. Russell, Comet Halley remote plasma tail observations and in-situ solar wind properties: Vega 1/2 IMF- plasma and ground-based optical observations from 1 Dec 85 to 1 May 1986, IWF 9003, Space Research Institute, Graz, Austria, 1990.

Delva, M., K. Schwingenschuh, M.B. Niedner, K.I. Gringauz, Comet Halley remote plasma tail observations and in-situ solar wind properties: Vega 1/2 IMF/plasma observations and ground-based optical observations from 1 December 1985 to 1 May 1986, Planet Space Sci, 39, 697- 708, 1991.

Data_Set_PDS3.citation_text: Delva, M., VEGA1 ORIGINAL MISCHA DATA SUBMISSION, VEGA1-C/SW-MISCHA-3-RDR-ORIGINAL-V1.0, NASA Planetary Data System, 1997.
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_terse_desc: Original magnetometer (MISCHA) data delivery from the Vega 1 spacecraft covering 22 Dec 1984 through 31 Dec 1986.
Data_Set_PDS3.abstract_desc: This data set includes the original Vega 1 MISCHA data delivery to PDS. The data were provided by Magda Delva of the MISCHA instrument team. The data are provided in ASCII format as well as the original IBM/PC binary format in which they were delivered to PDS. This data set was created for purposes of 'safing' these data. Significant concerns exist with regards to data quality. Specifically one of the instrument sensors saturated near closest approach to the comet Halley.
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_desc:
Data set Overview ================= This data set includes the original Vega 1 MISCHA data delivery to PDS. The data were provided by Magda Delva of the MISCHA instrument team. The data are provided in ASCII format as well as the original IBM/PC binary format in which they were delivered to PDS. This data set was created for purposes of 'safing' these data. Significant concerns exist with regards to data quality. Specifically one of the instrument sensors saturated near closest approach to the comet Halley.
Note that the time format provided in the binary data files is seconds since 1 Jan 1965 00:00:00, not including leap seconds.
